com.adobe.creativesdk.typekit

Class AdobeTypekitFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.creativesdk.typekit.AdobeTypekitFont

  • public final class AdobeTypekitFont
extends java.lang.Object
    AdobeTypekitFont is the class through which user handles operations with Typekit fonts.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AdobeTypekitFont.FontFilePath
      The class provides the details of the font file.
      static interface  AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<T,ET>
      Interface used to indicate the result of an operation related to Typekit Font.

    • Method Detail

      • createTypekitFont

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future createTypekitFont(java.lang.String typekitId,
                                                            java.lang.String typekitFamilyId,
                                                            AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<java.lang.String,AdobeTypekitException> callback)
        Create a Typekit font using the Typekit ID and Typekit Font Family ID.
        Parameters:
        typekitId - the Typekit ID, ex: TkD-21957-e59a6da5e24742ce8b94813235787d1761342174.
        typekitFamilyId - the Font Family Opaque ID, ex: lgmv.
        callback - the callback to notify the success/error. On success, the font object and the postscript name of the font is provided in the callback.
        Returns:
        the Future task that was scheduled.

      • getFonts

        public static java.util.ArrayList<AdobeTypekitFont> getFonts()
        The list of fonts in the user's Typekit account. The list contains the fonts in the user's sync list and the fonts bundled with the application.
        Returns:
        the list of fonts.

      • createFontWithPostscriptName

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future createFontWithPostscriptName(java.lang.String postScriptName,
                                                                       AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<AdobeTypekitFont,AdobeTypekitException> callback)
        Creates a font based on the postscript name of the font.
        Parameters:
        postScriptName - the postscript name of the font, ex: Sarina-Regular.
        callback - the callback object to return the created font on success or report the error. The font creation can fail if the user does not have permission or if the postscript name is not a valid font name.
        Returns:
        the Future task that was scheduled.

      • getFontID

        public java.lang.String getFontID()
        Get the Typekit Font ID.
        Returns:
        font ID.

      • getFamilyID

        public java.lang.String getFamilyID()
        Get the Typekit Font family ID.
        Returns:
        family ID.

      • getFontFamily

        public AdobeTypekitFontFamily getFontFamily()
        The font family to which this font variant belongs.
        Returns:
        the font family

      • getFontProperty

        public java.lang.String getFontProperty(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String property)
        Get the Font property value from the Typekit details.
        Parameters:
        property - the font property.
        Returns:
        the font property value.

      • isBundledFont

        public boolean isBundledFont()
        Checks if the font is a bundled font. Bundled fonts are the fonts that are displayed to the user by default in the font picker, since initially for new users the sync list is empty.
        Returns:
        true if it is a bundled font.

      • displayName

        public java.lang.String displayName()
        The display name of the font.
        Returns:
        the display name of the font, usually in format "FontFamily Variant"

      • postscriptName

        public java.lang.String postscriptName()
        The postscript name of the font. Uniquely identifies the font and can be exchanged with other applications.
        Returns:
        the post name of the font, usually in format "FontFamily-Variant"

      • getFontVariation

        public java.lang.String getFontVariation()
        The font variant style information. Ex: Italic, Bold, Regular etc.,
        Returns:
        the font variation string.

      • getFontFormat

        public java.lang.String getFontFormat()
        The font file format.
        Returns:
        the font format, ex: otf.

      • getSubsetTypeface

        @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future getSubsetTypeface(@NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String subsetText,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<android.graphics.Typeface,AdobeTypekitException> callback)
        Returns the Typeface with the minimum glyphs necessary to render the subsetText
        Parameters:
        subsetText - the text that needs to be rendered using this font.
        callback - callback to handle the result.
        Returns:
        returns the Future task that was scheduled to download the font. The download can be cancelled using Future.cancel(boolean). If the font files are available locally and no network operation was scheduled, then null is returned.

      • getTypeface

        @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future getTypeface(@NonNull
                                                         AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<android.graphics.Typeface,AdobeTypekitException> callback)
        Returns the Typeface with the all glyphs in the font. If the text is know in advance, it is recommended to use getSubsetTypeface(String, ITypekitCallback) which optimizes the download based on the necessary glyphs.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to handle the result.
        Returns:
        returns the Future task that was scheduled to download the font. The download can be cancelled using Future.cancel(boolean). If the font files are cached and no network operation was scheduled, then null is returned.

      • getSubsetFontFile

        @Nullable
public java.util.concurrent.Future getSubsetFontFile(@NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String subsetText,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<AdobeTypekitFont.FontFilePath,AdobeTypekitException> callback)
        Returns the ttf font file which contains the minimum set of glyphs necessary to render the subsetText.
        Parameters:
        subsetText - the text that needs to be rendered using this font.
        callback - callback to handle the result.
        Returns:
        returns the Future task that was scheduled to download the font. The download can be cancelled using Future.cancel(boolean). If the font files are cached and no network operation was scheduled, then null is returned.

      • getFontFile

        public void getFontFile(@NonNull
                        AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<java.util.concurrent.Future,AdobeTypekitException> downloadStartedCallback,
                        @NonNull
                        AdobeTypekitFont.ITypekitCallback<AdobeTypekitFont.FontFilePath,AdobeTypekitException> downloadCompleteCallback)
        Returns the font file which contains all the glyphs provided by the font. If the text to be rendered is known in advance use getSubsetFontFile(String, ITypekitCallback) to download the optimized font file. This call also adds the font to the user sync list, since it is necessary for the font to exist in sync list to be downloaded completely.
        Parameters:
        downloadStartedCallback - callback to notify the start of font download. This callback provides a Future which can be used to cancel the download using Future.cancel(boolean). If the font files are cached and no network operation was scheduled, then this callback is not made.
        downloadCompleteCallback - callback to notify the completion of font download.

      • addToSelection

        public void addToSelection(@Nullable
                           IAdobeGenericCompletionCallback<java.lang.String> onSuccess,
                           @Nullable
                           IAdobeGenericErrorCallback<AdobeTypekitException> onError)
        Adds the font to selection list. On success, the event TypekitNotification.Event.FONT_ADDED_TO_SYNC_LIST is issued.
        Parameters:
        onSuccess - callback on success.
        onError - callback on error.

      • isDownloaded

        public boolean isDownloaded()
        Checks if the font has been downloaded. For Bundled fonts, availability in assets is checked.
        Returns:
        true if downloaded.

      • removeFromSelection

        public void removeFromSelection()
        Removes the font from selection list. On success, the event TypekitNotification.Event.FONT_REMOVED_FROM_SYNC_LIST is issued.

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected()
        Checks if the font in users' selection or sync list.
        Returns:
        true if the font is in user selection list.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares if the two Font objects are same. They need not be the same object, the underlying font id and font family id are used for comparision.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the other object.
        Returns:
        true if the font family IDs are same.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns an integer hash code for this object. By contract, any two objects for which equals(java.lang.Object) returns true must return the same hash code value. This means that subclasses of Object usually override both methods or neither method.

        Note that hash values must not change over time unless information used in equals comparisons also changes.

        See Writing a correct hashCode method if you intend implementing your own hashCode method.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        this object's hash code.
        See Also:
        equals(java.lang.Object)

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
